title: AffineTransform Object — AffineTransform
text: AffineTransform uses 3x3 matrix implied last row [ 0 0 1 ] transform source coordinates (x,y) destination coordinates (x', y') according : x' x = shear_y scale_y translate_y 1 [ 1 ] transformation, x' = scale_x * x + shear_x * y + translate_x; y' = scale_y * y + shear_y * x + translate_y; message therefore composed six matrix elements.

title: CreateImageRequest Object — CreateImageRequest
text: objectId (string) user-supplied object ID. specify ID, must unique among pages page elements presentation. ID must start alphanumeric character underscore (matches regex [-zA-Z0-9_]); remaining characters may include well hyphen colon (matches regex [-zA-Z0-9_-:]). length ID must less 5 greater 50. specify ID, unique one generated. elementProperties (PageElementProperties) element properties image. aspect ratio provided size match image aspect ratio, image scaled centered respect size order maintain aspect ratio. provided transform applied operation. PageElementProperties.size property optional. specify size, default size image used. PageElementProperties.transform property optional. specify transform, image placed top-left corner page. url (string) image URL. image fetched insertion time copy stored display inside presentation. Images must less 50 MB size, exceed 25 megapixels, must one PNG, JPEG, GIF formats. provided URL must publicly accessible 2 KB length. URL saved image, exposed Image.source_url field.

what: Applies one or more updates to the presentation. Each request is validated before being applied. If any request is not valid, then the entire request will fail and nothing will be applied. Some requests have replies to give you some information about how they are applied. Other requests do not need to return information; these each return an empty reply. The order of replies matches that of the requests. For example, suppose you call batchUpdate with four updates, and only the third one returns information. The response would have two empty replies: the reply to the third request, and another empty reply, in that order. Because other users may be editing the presentation, the presentation might not exactly reflect your changes: your changes may be altered with respect to collaborator changes. If there are no collaborators, the presentation should reflect your changes. In any case, the updates in your request are guaranteed to be applied together atomically. — presentations.batchUpdate
